@Gabriel Quesada must allow negative number in the case of an adjustment (not for payment). If the number is negative, it will decrease the balance. If positive, it will increase the balance.
@Gabriel Quesada this should probably prepopulate payor and invoice # if user selects Apply Payment from a generated Invoice
@Gabriel Quesada this value technically should be updated once a payment is applied to this specific invoice #

@Gabriel Quesada technically, you can only have 1 period in a status that is not locked (all periods must be locked) except for one. You cannot create and work with more than one payroll period at a time.  Locking allows you to create a new period

I know she didn't mark it as MVP but - doesn't it make sense that the Acknowledgement / dismissal is better than trying to surface forms based on some other critieria?   Let's look at the workflow agaon

@Alicia Peters we created a workflow for the Incident form on the CC Dashboard.  Abbey also had Acknowledgement as a "High" in the prioritization sheet. I think that's what makes it go away. She also has dismissing BG Check alert as a "High" - so - I think the Acknowledgement is what makes it go away. Thinking that might actually be a better experience.

@Ericka Campos @Beverly Sexton For incident forms, we should have a rule where we get the forms within the last x hours.  Maybe 72?  Since we aren't dismissing the alerts, how far back should we get the forms?  Do they just want to know what was the entered for the previous day?

@Ericka Campos Let's talk about the UX of the date filter. It will be a lot of of records to scroll through and not easy to find.  We are also worried the visits that will end within the next 7 days won't be seen.  Could it be a tile at the top that they click to expand?  Its also a separate api call that needs to be made.
@Ericka Campos We don't have todos assigned to a specific person.  This should indicate if you are the primary or secondary care manager.
@Ericka Campos What are the filter options for care partner tasks?

@Ericka Campos @Beverly Sexton @Gabriel Quesada Let's talk about these filters more.  If you filter by client, I'm not sure it makes sense to also filter by care manager.  And filtering by date changes the "Today" section meaning.  "Today" is no longer valid.  Probably just showing the current date would fix that.  And we would need to paginate through the list.  A long list that keeps loading as you scroll won't work when you have the 7 days expiration section below.  You may never see the 7 days section. That could be a count instead and they can click to see the list.

@Ericka Campos @Gabriel Quesada Greyed out if one or more selected that are in SENT status (emailed or marked as sent) or VOIDED.  Cannot delete if SENT or VOID status
@Ericka Campos @Gabriel Quesada RULE: Greyed out if one or more selected that are NOT approved

Apply Amounts

@Ericka Campos @Gabriel Quesada should default to today's date however - I'm thinking we still need to keep track of the transaction date and show on the drawer, as the posting date and transaction date could be different
@Ericka Campos add a Type?  Payment or Adjustment
@Ericka Campos we  may need to show what a negative amount looks like (for an adjustment that's a credit)
@Ericka Campos we may have a transaction date in addition to Posting date.
@Ericka Campos I don't think we need financially responsible party, but, we do need Type (i.e. Payment or Adjustment)
@Ericka Campos Transaction Details
@Ericka Campos there will need to be a condition where, if a Payment is on an existing Invoice, or if an Adjustment has been applied to an Invoice it cannot be edited or deleted
@Ericka Campos or Adjustment, depending on type
@Ericka Campos or Adjustment, depending on type
@Gabriel Quesada @Ericka Campos also now, if there is a valid and effective financially responsible party, they cannot be deleted.

@Ericka Campos @Gabriel Quesada I'm not sure this note on Tags is true any more exactly.   We can have multiple FRPs, but only one can be effective (set at Client financial /billing settings).   And suggested only effective one shows with tag.  If client is Self-Pay we can can still keep the tag if it's showing, but, self-pay will trump because it makes FRP invalid.

@Gabriel Quesada @Ericka Campos logic only - only the "current" financially responsible party can display. 

If we allow the "effective date" to be chosen on the client profile under Financial / Billing or whatever, then we can have more than one Financially Responsible Party, but, only the current one will be flagged

@Ericka Campos also, when defining a mail preference when Self-Pay is on, if the preference contains "Email" we must check that there is a client email defined in Client Information (validation error)

@Ericka Campos @Gabriel QuesadaI think this validation stays here - where: you can't save a client service IF the payor is of type Client Individual, and if they are NOT toggled on for Self pay OR they do not have any financially responsible party defined
@Ericka Campos suggest Billing frequency travels with the Self Pay / FRP details onto the Client Profile - in the existing Financial Section?
@Ericka Campos @Gabriel Quesada The Billing Contact will just go away from here (no need to assign if they are a Billing Contact in Client Contacts that is all we need to know)

@Ericka Campos @Gabriel Quesada suggest hiding or putting in graveyard "Invoices and Payments" and instead we may have a section or pay for "Billing Details"

Within "Billing Details" we could have a page for
1. Client Current Balance 
2. Whether or not client is Self-Pay (with mail preference defined) and
3. Whether or not the client will have the Financially Responsible party selection menu and  (with ability to add a different one w/ effective date)
4. The Billing Frequency (Monthly or Weekly)

@Ericka Campos If the private pay financially responsible party's email preference is not email, then Email is not an option for the invoice.  Only manual mark as Sent

@Ericka Campos here's a breakdown of our menu options based on status
If Failed:
Regenerate or Delete
If Sent:
Email, Download, Apply, Void (no delete), 
If Voided:
Download (no other options)
If Generated (simple): 
Email, Download, Apply, Delete
If Approved (all approvals)
Email, Download, Apply, Delete
If not All Approved: 
Download, Delete
